Celebrate Guru Pournami
July 2016
 

A Guru is not someone who holds a torch for you. He is the torch.

- Sadhguru

 

Dear {{FIRST_NAME}},

Guru Purnima, traditionally, is a time for seekers to offer their gratitude to the Guru, and receive his blessings. This day is also considered an especially beneficial day for meditation and sadhana.

Join us for an evening of meditation, Joy and Grace on Tuesday, 19th July 2016;

Melbourne

Time: 6pm - 8pm

Venue: Please RSVP to receive the venue details

Volunteers' Meet in Melbourne
 

We will be having a quick catch up on what's in store for the remainder of the year especially with our second Bhava Spandana happening in October; some time to get to know each other and welcome our new volunteers.

Date: Sun, 17 July 2016, 11am - 12:30pm

Register for Volunteers Meeting
 

Sadhguru explains why Guru Purnima is so significant, and tells us how this is the day Adiyogi, the first yogi, became a guru, and transmitted technologies to evolve oneself beyond all boundaries. “The limitations of life and death, one can cross, if one is willing to strive for it,” Sadhguru says

He also looks at how each of the full moons in a year have a unique quality, and how the full moon or Purnima, and new moon or Amavasya, are significant for spiritual seekers. He talks of a system of yoga calibrated so one can make use of the lunar and solar cycles, and take natureâ€™s help.
